context: <a3_0>Over <b10_0>90<b10_0/><a3_0/> weeklies, fortnightlies and quarterlies are published in <a6_0>Sanskrit<a6_0/>. <b11_0><b14_0>Sudharma<b14_0/><b11_0/>, a <a5_0>daily newspaper<a5_0/> in Sanskrit, has been published out of <a7_0>Mysore, India<a7_0/>, since <a0_0>1970<a0_0/>, while Sanskrit <b13_0><b15_0>Vartman Patram<b15_0/> and Vishwasya Vrittantam<b13_0/> started in <a1_0>Gujarat<a1_0/> during the last five years. Since <a2_0><a8_0><b16_0>1974<b16_0/><a8_0/><a2_0/>, there has been a <b12_0>short daily news broadcast<b12_0/> on state-run All India Radio. These broadcasts are also made available on the internet on <a9_0>AIR's website<a9_0/>. <b17_0>Sanskrit news<b17_0/> is broadcast on TV and on the internet through the <b18_0>DD National channel<b18_0/> at <a4_0>6:55 AM IST<a4_0/>.
